author: BrucePay
body:
<!--

If you are a PowerShell Team member, please make sure you choose the Reviewer(s) and Assignee for your PR.
If you are not from the PowerShell Team, you can leave the fields blank and the Maintainers will choose them for you. If you are familiar with the team, feel free to mention some Reviewers yourself.

For more information about the roles of Reviewer and Assignee, refer to CONTRIBUTING.md.

-->

Fix for #3931. With this change, globbing for native commands will not longer be done if the argument string is quoted (single or double quotes).

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: @BrucePay - please rebase, and look at the log before force pushing to ensure only your commits appear between master and your branch.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @lzybkr looks like the commits got cleaned up and the CI is passing, any other concerns?

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: Folks, we could **REALLY** use this fix!  We have scripts that broke when we recently updated from an old alpha to beta.8.  ATM we've found no workaround other than to fall back to Bash.

title: Fix globbing for native commands
